You’re tired. It’s time to 1lie down, turn off the light, and relax your head on a comfortable 2pillow. But what happens if you’re an astronaut? In space, it’s hard to sleep. There’s no difference between night and day and astronauts often
3stay awake for a long time. But it’s good if you’re scared of
4the dark because the sun comes up every 90 minutes in space! It would be exciting to 5stay up late and watch the stars through the window. When astronauts finally 6fall asleep, they dream about discovering new planets.
